intro: Hedyotis stenophylla, commonly known as narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces tiny, elliptical berries that contain the seeds. Hedyotis stenophylla is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
